Question Seventeen

The color gamut in chromaticity coordinates is equivalent to the triangle in RGB space that is defined by the primaries. Write a program that will display this triangle and the edges of the cube in which it lies. Each point on the triangle should have the color determined by its coordinates in RGB space. This triangle is called the Maxwell triangle.

MaxwellTriangle Class

class MaxwellTriangle

A class for generating and displaying the Maxwell Triangle with RGB cube edges.

Variables:

  • size (int) – Size of the output image.

  • image (PIL.Image) – Image object for storing the generated image.

  • draw (PIL.ImageDraw) – Draw object for drawing on the image.

__init__(size)

Initialize the MaxwellTriangle object.

Parameters:

size (int) – Size of the output image.

draw_triangle()

Draw the Maxwell triangle and the edges of the RGB cube.

rgb_to_xy(rgb)

Convert RGB coordinates to image coordinates.

Parameters:

rgb (tuple) – RGB coordinates.

Returns:

Tuple of image coordinates.

show()

Display the generated image.

save(filename)

Save the generated image to a file.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Name of the file to save the image.

Example usage:

if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Set the size parameter
    image_size = 500

    # Create a MaxwellTriangle object
    maxwell_triangle = MaxwellTriangle(image_size)

    # Draw and display the Maxwell triangle with RGB cube edges
    maxwell_triangle.draw_triangle()
    maxwell_triangle.show()

    # Save the image to a file
    maxwell_triangle.save("maxwell_triangle_oop.png")
